    • Field Detail

      • min_double

        public static final double min_double
        The IEEE 754 format has one bit reserved for the sign and the remaining bits representing the magnitude. This means that it is "symmetrical" around origo (as opposed to the Integer values, which have one more negative value). Thus the minimum value is simply the same as the maximum value, with the sign-bit changed, so yes, -Double.MAX_VALUE is the smallest possible actual number you can represent with a double. We are more interested to keep this value constant. By setting in this way the similarity between a pair of nodes whose true similarity is unknown, we reserve the possibility of not making communications between that pair, thus optimizing the algorithm.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isMinDouble

        public static boolean isMinDouble(double value)

      • buildGraph

        public static double[][] buildGraph(java.lang.String similarity_file,
                                    java.lang.String similarity_regex,
                                    java.lang.String preference_file,
                                    boolean median_preference,
                                    double sigma)
        Build a graph from a file which each line contains {i, j, s(i,j)}
        Parameters:
        similarity_file - input file location
        similarity_regex - Regular expression for the division of each line. It is assumed that there are no more than one triple per line.
        preference_file - Location of the preference file. Line i contains s(i, i) It is assumed that there are no more than one preference per line.
        median_preference - If false : preference are loaded from file If true : preference are computed locally
        sigma - Preference noise's order of magnitude
        Returns:
        similarity graph

      • buildGraph

        public static double[][] buildGraph(java.lang.String matrix_file,
                                    double preference,
                                    boolean use_preference,
                                    boolean zeroAsInf,
                                    double sigma)
        Build a graph from a file which each line contains {s(i,0),s(i,1),...,s(i,n)}
        Parameters:
        matrix_file - location of file
        preference - constant value of preference
        use_preference - If true : forAll s(i,i) = preference If false : do_nothing
        zeroAsInf - If true : if(s(i,j) == 0) s(i,j) = -INF
        sigma - Preference noise's order of magnitude
        Returns:
        similarity graph

      • buildGraphRandom

        public static double[][] buildGraphRandom(int size)
        Create a random and for test only graph of size node. 30% of s(i,j) is -INF
        Parameters:
        size - of graph
        Returns:
        graph

      • GetMedian

        private static double GetMedian(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> input)
        You sort the n data in ascending order (or decreasing order) If n number of data is equal The median is estimated using The two values that occupy the positions (n / 2) and ((n / 2) +1) The median corresponds to the central value, Or the value occupying the position (n + 1) / 2 I subtract two to compensate for the fact that counts from 0
        Parameters:
        input - triple of loaded values like {i, j, s(i,j)} We only use third value
        Returns:
        median value

        Returns:
